text:
ðŸš« Blocking merge until EU auth latency is addressed. Current benchmark (auth_eu_p95 = 812 ms) exceeds our SLA target of 500 ms. Before this PR can proceed, please:
	1.	Roll out Redis-based session caching to reduce DB roundtrips.
	2.	Implement edge token validation to cut request latency.
	3.	Attach a rollback plan in case the cache rollout introduces regressions.

Apply these optimizations and re-run the benchmark. Once auth_eu_p95 < 500 ms, remove the needs-perf-fix label and tag reviewers for re-approval. Performance SLAs are non-negotiable for login-critical flows.

structured_data.summary: Ensure auth_eu_p95 is below 500 ms SLA threshold
structured_data.additionalNotes: Performance must meet login SLA for EU users to ensure reliable access.

structured_data.summary: Roll out Redis session caching to reduce DB latency
structured_data.additionalNotes: Minimizes roundtrips for active session lookup by caching session state in Redis.

structured_data.summary: Implement edge token validation for faster auth
structured_data.additionalNotes: Improves performance by validating access tokens at the edge before backend routing.

structured_data.summary: Provide rollback plan for session cache deployment
structured_data.additionalNotes: Ensures safe fallback if Redis-based caching introduces regressions in production.
